verses.roman:
ity uktvā tān samādāya
indrasenena pūjitau
punar dvāravatīm etya
mātuḥ putrān ayacchatām

synonyms: iti—thus; uktvā—speaking; tān—them; samādāya—taking; indrasenena—by Bali Mahārāja; pūjitau—both honored; punaḥ—once more; dvāravatīm—to Dvārakā; etya—going; mātuḥ—of Their mother; putrān—the sons; ayacchatām—They presented.
translation: [Śukadeva Gosvāmī continued:] After saying this, Lord Kṛṣṇa and Lord Balarāma, having been duly worshiped by Bali Mahārāja, took the six sons and returned to Dvārakā, where They presented them to Their mother.
